original: Öhlin, Paul Gustaf, lektor. Skara, f. 27/6/87 i Böne, Älvsb. 1., av folkskodl. Alfred Ö. o. Albertina Josefina Zachri-son. G. 1. 18 m. Ulla-Lisa Bager-Sjö-gren, d. 25; 2. 41 m. Karin Nauclér. Barn: Ulla f. 20, g. m. tekn. stud. Erik Norberg. — Stud:ex. i Malmö 09, fil. kand. i Lund 13, fil. mag. 14, fil. lic. 17, fil. dr 18 samt provår 20-21. Vik. adj. i Lund 16-17, timlär. v. Lunds fullst. lärov. f. fl. 16-18, e. o. lektor i Eksjö ht. 19, lär. v. Lunds priv. elem:-sk. 21-26, lektor i hist. o. modersm. v. Skara h. a. 1. sed. 25. Ordf. i komm:-stämma o. flera komm. ndr i Ormes-berga 19-23, självskr. led. av Skara domkap. 25-36, däreft. utn. av K. Maj :t, led. av Skara kyrkofullm. 3’2-46, lokalstyr. f. lärov. sed. 33, drätsel-kamm. 36-43, stadsfullm. 38-46, styr. f. stifts- o. landsbibi. sed. 43; insp. f. Skara föreläsn :fören. sed. 35, v. ordf. i styr. f. komm. flicksk. sed. 44. Res. t. Norge, Danm., Tyskl., Engl, Frankr. o. Schw^eiz. Skr.: Stud. över de passiva konstruktionerna i fornsv. (grad :avh. 18), Kringlarpssläkten (37), art. o rec. RNO.
translated: Öhlin, Paul Gustaf, lecturer. Skara, b. 27/6/87 in Böne, Älvsb. 1., son of primary school teacher Alfred Ö. and Albertina Josefina Zachrisson. Married 1. in 18 with Ulla-Lisa Bager-Sjögren, passed away 25; 2. in 41 with Karin Nauclér. Children: Ulla, born in 20, married to technical student Erik Norberg. — Studied: exam in Malmö in 09, Bachelor of Arts in Lund in 13, Master of Arts in 14, Licentiate of Philosophy in 17, Doctor of Philosophy in 18, and probationary year in 20-21. Temporary teacher in Lund in 16-17, hourly teacher at Lund's full-time high school for several years in 16-18, temporary lecturer in Eksjö in the autumn of 19, teacher at Lund's private elementary school in 21-26, lecturer in history and mother tongue at Skara higher secondary school since 25. Chairman of the municipal assembly and several municipal committees in Ormesberga in 19-23, ex-officio member of Skara cathedral chapter from 25 to 36, thereafter appointed by the Royal Majesty, member of Skara church council from 32-46, local government board for high schools since 33, finance committee from 36-43, city council from 38-46, board for diocese and rural libraries since 43; inspector for Skara lecture association since 35, vice-chairman of the board for municipal girls' school since 44. Traveled to Norway, Denmark, Germany, England, France, and Switzerland. Writings: Study on passive constructions in Old Swedish (degree thesis in 18), The Kringlarps Family (37), articles and reviews in RNO [unknown abbreviation].
